title: Syria's government reaches agreement with Kurds of Rojava
subhead: A ceasefire has been established after three weeks of fighting. The Kurds have secured major gains in local autonomy and national rights, while the Syrian president claims to have restored national unity.

title: Gaza civil defense says 22 killed in Israeli strikes
France tightens infant formula rules after toxin scare
Appeals trial for murder of teacher Samuel Paty focuses on defendants' personal lives
subhead: The first week of hearings at the Special Criminal Court exposed the contradictions of the defendants Brahim Chnina and Abdelhakim Sefrioui. They were found guilty of participation in a terrorist criminal conspiracy for the 2020 killing.

title: Iran state media report explosion at building in Bandar Abbas, cause unknown
subhead: State television said an explosion occurred on Saturday at an eight-story building in Bandar Abbas, with the cause of the explosion under investigation.

title: Catherine O'Hara, iconic comedy figure, dies age 71
subhead: Known for her roles in 'Beetlejuice' and 'Home Alone' on the big screen, and more recently in the series 'Schitt's Creek,' the Canadian-American actress died on Friday, January 30, in Los Angeles following an illness.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
Venezuela's interim president announces mass amnesty law
US Senate passes deal expected to shorten shutdown
Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
US approves multibillion-dollar arms sales to both Israel and Saudi Arabia
In Svalbard, where sea ice is vanishing faster than anywhere else, polar bears remain healthy
Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
US Justice Department releases over 3 million more pages of Epstein files
Pieter Mulier leaves Maison Alaïa
Beehives, yachts and cattle: How France manages 'atypical' seized assets
Nestlé knew of toxins in baby formula 10 days before first recalls
Paris reaches the pinnacle of haute couture
'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhead: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhead: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
The need to speak truth about immigration
Zaki Laïdi, political scientist: 'In 2025, building spheres of influence is infinitely more difficult than during the Cold War'
